channel.title: RSPS Server Written in Python 2.7 (PyScape)
channel.description:
First of all, Yeah guys, I'm back :D
[b](ALSO: Yes, this thread is very blank right now. There isn't much to show, unless I post random pictures of my IDE + Random code ;D)[/b]
During the time I was gone, I didn't have access to the internet too much, so I set upon making a server written from scratch in Python (v2.7.x).
I'm not doing this so much for server functionality/speed, as much as for the challenge, And mainly because in the 4 years or so I've been doing this, I've never seen a RSPS programmed in python. That being said, I know python is a very slow language, since its interpreted, rather than compiled like JAVA. (Another side note, I'm planning on just using a Jagex 317 deob client. Programming one of those in python would be a living hell).
After writing some of the basic framework for the server, I realized its going to be very hard to do alone. If anyone is interested in helping me, just send me a PM.
Thanks guys.
[b]EDIT: I accidently a word.[/b]

item.title: RSPS Server Written in Python 2.7 (PyScape)
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:5, topic:464046”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=567820.msg4124078#msg4124078 date=1350167833]
do it in ruby.

#sinisoul - anything java can do ruby does better
[/quote]
Lol.

So it’s going to be interpreted, (I don’t even know if you could run it independently), that’s gonna be completely inefficient, but good luck lol.[/quote]

It has actually been done before in Ruby, if I remember correctly.

Read full topic
